WorkItem.Description:
Visiting the 
http://www.codeplex.com/Release/ProjectReleases.aspx?ProjectName=ASCENDNET
page and clicking on the "Ascend.NET English Documentation" link returns a file for download called "Ascend.NET" it should probably be called "Ascend.NET.chm" as the windows sees the .net extension and throws up it's hands in confusion.
WorkItem.Summary: The Ascend.NET english help file doesn't have the .chm extension when downloaded from the site.

Comments.Message:
This is not the first time I've heard this over the last few months.
The strange thing is it is uploaded with the CHM extension and every time I download it has the CHM extension. 
Could you confirm that it does this a second time?

This occurs in Firefox (tested in 1.5.07) and not in IE (6.0).  It might be caused by a wider issue with the browser caps settings on the codeplex site, or problems with a name with a '.' in it.  Can I recommend trying to upload a help file called "AscendNET.chm" or "Ascend_NET.chm" and see if this fixes the firefox issue.
I posted a zipped version of the help file for the release. It does not have a '.' in the name. Let me know if this prevents the Firefox issue. If it does I'll make to do it this way from now on.
